Data: Herath to Hussey, no run doesn't turn in as much as expected, gets a soft outside edge. No slip in place
Herath to Hussey, 1 run comes down the track to take this on the full, gets a single wide of mid-on
Herath to Khawaja, no run again gets to see a big gap between Khawaja's bat and pad, hits the inside half of the bat
Herath to Khawaja, no run closer to off now, plays this one more comfortably
Herath to Khawaja, 1 run leading edge, dies right into the ground. Closes the face to this outside off. Looking very uncertain
Herath to Hussey, no run forward in solid defence, is Hussey
Randiv to Khawaja, no run and gets an edge first ball. Pitches middle and leg, turns away, Khawaja closes the face, but the edge dies in front of slip
Randiv to Khawaja, no run defended towards midwicket
Randiv to Khawaja, 1 run swept away along the ground, gets a single
Randiv to Hussey, no run nicely tossed up, pitches middle and off, defended
Randiv to Hussey, no run another forward-defensive, towards cover
Randiv to Hussey, no run flighted outside off, Hussey pushes forward and defends
Herath to Khawaja, no run sharp turn, Khawaja stays back to defend this to midwicket
Herath to Khawaja, no run comes forward this time to block this length ball
Herath to Khawaja, no run this pitches just short of a length, outside off, turning in, defended with soft hands
Herath to Khawaja, 1 run flatter, pushed with an open face, gets a single
Herath to Hussey, no run floated across him, defended to off
Herath to Hussey, no run another one slides across him, Hussey covers the turn with the pad, and shoulders arms
Randiv to Khawaja, no run full offbreak, middle and off, defended to leg
Randiv to Khawaja, no run full again, defended to cover
Randiv to Khawaja, no run pushed to cover now, slightly more forceful in this defensive shot
Randiv to Khawaja, no run sharp offbreak, pitches middle and off, and breaks away. Defended with soft hands
Randiv to Khawaja, no run too full, easy for Khawaja to smother the turn
Randiv to Khawaja, 1 run slower through the air, shorter too, pushed wide of point for one

Lakmal to Khawaja, no run Big shout first up. They are going for the review for the inside edge. This is short of a length, looks like it will angle across, but holds its line slightly, and Khawaja punches away from the body. There is a sound as it passes the bat, although the replays don't conclusively prove there is an inside edge onto the pad and then through to P Jayawardene. More drama. This is a bit of a farce real
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run full outside off, defended to cover
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run length ball, angling across, pushed to cover
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
Lakmal to Khawaja, 3 runs a touch too straight, and it's whipped away off the pads for three. Already signs that Khawaja prefers pace to spin
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run length ball on the pads, he works this wide of mid-on for one
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run clipped off the pads for one
Randiv to Khawaja, no run flighted outside off, defended to cover
Randiv to Khawaja, no run this one doesn't turn in, Khawaja gets an inside edge towards square leg
Randiv to Khawaja, no run flighted outside off, slight turn away, defended
Randiv to Khawaja, no run more turn, but Khawaja doesn't play at this one, sees it safely through to PJ
Randiv to Khawaja, 1 run pushed with an open face, gets a single wide of point

Lakmal to Khawaja, 1 run Khawaja presses forward, pushes this to mid-off, runs through for one, Dilshan swoops on this, tries an underarm flick, his momentum carries him into a collision with Khawaja, who is now down on the ground
Lakmal to Hussey, no run a hint of swing back in for Hussey, who gets the bat down in time
Lakmal to Hussey, no run nice cover-drive by Hussey to this one angling across him. Finds extra cover, though
Lakmal to Hussey, no run slower ball, Hussey delays the shot, pushes this towards cover
Lakmal to Hussey, no run length ball, outside off, pushed to mid-off
Lakmal to Hussey, no run bouncer, sways away from its line
Randiv to Khawaja, no run no turn, this one slips down the leg side
Randiv to Khawaja, no run offbreak now, pitches outside off, left alone
Randiv to Khawaja, no run another sharp offbreak, defended off the back foot
Randiv to Khawaja, 2 runs full on the pads, clipped away for a single
Randiv to Khawaja, no run quicker delivery, goes for the cut, not short enough to be cut, but he manages to keep this down
Randiv to Khawaja, no run flighted around middle and off, defended off the front foot
Lakmal to Hussey, no run length ball, on the pads, pushed to mid-on
Lakmal to Hussey, FOUR runs slower offcutter, nicely played with an open face, steered away really, between slips and gully, for the first boundary in 83 balls
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run length ball, on the pads, worked around the corner for one
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run full, middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Lakmal to Khawaja, 1 run tip and run here, this one doesn't go too far off the pitch, towards midwicket, and they charge through
Lakmal to Hussey, no run short of a length, middle and leg, defended off the back foot
Randiv to Khawaja, no run offbreak starts well outside off, left alone
Randiv to Khawaja, 1 run swept powerfully, along the ground, gets a single
Randiv to Hussey, no run big shout for lbw, this is the arm ball, beats the inside edge, but it has hit him outside the line of off
Randiv to Hussey, no run flighted outside off, defended with an open face
Randiv to Hussey, no run pushes right forward to smother the turn
Randiv to Hussey, 2 runs flat, into the pads, Hussey transfers the weight back, guides this towards fine leg for a couple
Lakmal to Khawaja, 2 runs bouncer, pulled away from outside off, hit into the ground, through midwicket for two
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run another short ball, outside off, Khawaja sways from the line of the ball
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run full, some late swing away from him, gets an edge into the ground, and then through towards slips. Falls well short of them too
Lakmal to Khawaja, 2 runs pulled away again, from chest-high, and keeps it down too, gets a couple
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run short of a length, around off, pushed to mid-off
Lakmal to Khawaja, no run offcutter, pitches just outside leg, is defended in front of off
Welegedara to Hussey, FOUR runs short and wide, and Hussey welcomes this with a steer through the vacant third man region
Welegedara to Hussey, no run fuller, wide of off, left alone
Welegedara to Hussey, no run full, a hint of late swing in towards Hussey, who pushes this to mid-off
Welegedara to Hussey, 3 runs and this one swings in late again, almost squeezing through, hits the inside half of the bat, past midwicket, for three runs
Welegedara to Khawaja, 1 run more late swing, Khawaja is a bit more loose than Hussey, gets an inside edge onto the the pad. Sneaks in the single

Welegedara to Hussey, no run yorker, this is surely reversing here. Big shout for lbw. Umpire Dar says not out. Dilshan challenges the call. Me, I would rarely question Dar. This is full, swinging in late, pitches in front of middle, hits him in front of leg, and would have missed the leg stump, so the original decision stays. Umpire Taufel, who is doing commentary right now, immediately made out from Dar's mannerisms th
Dilshan to Khawaja, no run sharp offbreak, pitches just outside off, beats the tentative Khawaja
Dilshan to Khawaja, no run right forward to push this to cover
Dilshan to Khawaja, 1 run quick flat offbreak, gets an edge, which dies right away, and goes past slip for one
Dilshan to Hussey, no run arm ball, around off, Hussey is right back to defend
Dilshan to Hussey, no run full and flat, defended back to the bowler
Dilshan to Hussey, no run slower through the air, Hussey defends off the front foot
Welegedara to Khawaja, no run swing for Welegedara again, Khawaja shoulders arms, but this one doesn't swing in enough

Welegedara to Khawaja, OUT Reverse swing! Timber! Khawaja's tentative stay ends. He has always shown the bowlers a tempting gap between bat and pad, and this time Welegedara sneaks through it. This is just short of a yorker length, Khawaja drives away from the body, and the late swing squeezes in to hit the stumps
Welegedara to Haddin, no run angled away, easy for Haddin to leave it be
Welegedara to Haddin, no run pitches middle and leg, swings away towards of, defended towards cover
Welegedara to Haddin, no run Beaten! Pitches middle and off, just short of a length, seams away, beats the hanging bat
Welegedara to Haddin, no run slower offcutter, Haddin is caught pushing in front of his body, it falls short of short extra cover, though
Dilshan to Hussey, no run full offbreak, pushed back to the bowler
Dilshan to Hussey, no run short outside off, pushed to cover
Dilshan to Hussey, no run short again, stays low, Hussey keeps this out
Dilshan to Hussey, 1 run charges at him, pushes this to mid-off, and keeps going through for a single

Dilshan to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin edges first ball of spin! Doesn't turn in as much as he expects it to, ends up playing inside the line, the edge goes between keeper and slip. Didn't carry as far as slip, though
Dilshan to Haddin, no run turning into the pads, defended to leg
Welegedara to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey covers the swing, opens the face, guides it through the vacant point region, and comes back for two

Welegedara to Hussey, FOUR runs looks for the swinging yorker, it goes wrong, and Hussey clips this low full toss through midwicket. Typical Hussey. Waits for slight errors from the bowling side, and capitalises
Welegedara to Hussey, no run pitched on a length, swinging in late, defended off the front foot
Welegedara to Hussey, 2 runs this is the one that goes straight through, Hussey reaches out and pushes with an open face for another couple
Welegedara to Hussey, no run covers the swing well, pushes this to mid-off
Welegedara to Hussey, no run this is better, swinging in late, just short of a yorker length, Hussey plays it late, towards midwicket
Dilshan to Haddin, 1 run sharp offbreak, helped around the corner for one
Dilshan to Hussey, no run tossed up around middle and leg, turning towards off, defended off the front foot
Dilshan to Hussey, no run teasing flat delivery outside off, looks for the cut but decides against it eventually
Dilshan to Hussey, no run right forward to smother the turn here
Dilshan to Hussey, no run tossed up outside leg, Hussey opens the stance up a bit and defends
Dilshan to Hussey, no run middle and leg again, Hussey closes the face early, but the leading edge falls short of Dilshan
Welegedara to Haddin, FOUR runs lovely extra cover drive. This is pitched on a length, wide outside off, Haddin is on a knee, and drives it through extra cover. All along the ground
Welegedara to Haddin, no run this is closer to off, and Haddin leaves it be
Welegedara to Haddin, no run full, middle and leg, moving towards off, defended back
Welegedara to Haddin, no run short of a length, swinging away, pushed to cover
Welegedara to Haddin, no run short of a length, defended with an angled bat
Welegedara to Haddin, 1 run similar delivery, but Haddin places this to the right of point, and rushes through for a single
Dilshan to Haddin, no run flat offbreak, into the pads, defended
Dilshan to Haddin, no run another quick offbreak, turned to midwicket
Dilshan to Haddin, no run goes deep into the crease to block this flat delivery outside off
Dilshan to Haddin, 1 run full, on the pads, pushed to long-on
Dilshan to Hussey, no run Hussey is forward to defend this to point
Dilshan to Hussey, 1 run short, on the pads, placed for a single wide of midwicket
Welegedara to Hussey, 1 run pushed to mid-off and charges through for a single. Hussey has alternated the strike superbly
Welegedara to Haddin, no run full, around off, defended with an open face
Welegedara to Haddin, no run short of a length, kicks off again, hits Haddin's fingers, but the ball doesn't lob up
Welegedara to Haddin, 1 run more good running, tips this towards cover, and rushes through for one
Welegedara to Hussey, no run full and wide, slight shape back in, driven to extra cover
Welegedara to Hussey, no run full and swinging in, but he seems tired now - this is 126ks, pushed to mid-off
Herath to Haddin, no run tossed up just outside off, Haddin shoulders arms and watches it turn away
Herath to Haddin, no run Haddin is forward to defend this length ball outside off
Herath to Haddin, no run tossed up, slightly wide, left alone
Herath to Haddin, no run this is the straighter one, less air, Haddin goes back to defend
Herath to Haddin, no run slight flight, and Haddin is quick to press forward. Defends this back
Herath to Haddin, no run another forward-defensive, this time towards cover
Randiv to Hussey, no run flighted outside off, defended to silly point
Randiv to Hussey, no run Hussey leave the crease, is beaten in the flight, pushes to silly point, and rushes back into the crease
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run only slightly short, and he is quick to go back and place it past point for one
Randiv to Haddin, no run Lovely bowling. You could see the extra revs on this. Pitched outside off, turned back, through the gap, hit the knee roll. Extra bounce saved an lbw here
Randiv to Haddin, no run flighted outside off, defended to cover
Randiv to Haddin, no run flatter, quicker, stays back and plays this back to the bowler
Herath to Hussey, no run turning in towards off, defended
Herath to Hussey, 1 run swept away for a single
Herath to Haddin, no run Haddin presses half-forward to defend this
Herath to Haddin, no run huge turn, Warnesque, pitches outside leg, beats the bat, hits the back pad in front of off. Sri Lanka are excited about a catch to gully, but it hasn't hit bat
Herath to Haddin, no run smothers the spin after pressing forward
Herath to Haddin, no run flighted outside off, left alone
Randiv to Hussey, no run flighted around middle and leg, defended
Randiv to Hussey, no run Hussey gives him the charge, gets to the pitch of the ball, pushes to cover
Randiv to Hussey, no run slightly shorter, and Hussey is right back to defend
Randiv to Hussey, no run stretches well forward to this flighted delivery and defends
Randiv to Hussey, no run pitches outside leg, covers the turn, plays it back to the bowler

Randiv to Hussey, FOUR runs a hard-working yet pretty unobtrusive sort of fifty on a tough pitch. This is flighted around middle an doff, he comes forward and punches this between mid-off and the bowler. Michael Clarke and others applaud from the balcony
Herath to Haddin, 1 run full, on the pads, worked wide of midwicket for one
Herath to Hussey, no run flighted outside off, driven to extra cover
Herath to Hussey, no run pushes at this one with bat and pad close together, defends towards cover
Herath to Hussey, no run Close! Looks to sweep this from outside off, plays the wrong line, the ball turns in sharply, misses the off stump not by much
Herath to Hussey, no run another flighted delivery, Hussey resists all temptation and defends

Herath to Hussey, no run lovely bowling, pushed through, 94ks, Hussey is taken by surprise, is late into it, is beaten, and is hit on the knee roll when deep in the crease. Huge shout obviously, but they are not getting any lbws from Kettleborough
Randiv to Haddin, SIX runs lovely straight drive. Beautiful swing of the arms after taking half a step down the track. Right over the bowler's head
Randiv to Haddin, no run flighted outside off, this time Haddin defends
Randiv to Haddin, FOUR runs more elegant batting from Haddin. Comes forward again, and swings his arms through it rather than trying to hit it hard. Clears mid-on with ease
Randiv to Haddin, no run driven along the ground, towards extra cover
Randiv to Haddin, 1 run Nearly there! Sharp offbreak, Haddin pushes at it in front of his body, gets an inside edge that bisects forward and backward short legs
Randiv to Hussey, no run tossed up around middle and leg, defended towards mid-off
Herath to Haddin, no run full outside off, defended back to Herath
Herath to Haddin, no run slower through the air, middle and leg, turning towards off, Haddin defends off the back foot
Herath to Haddin, no run this one keeps drifting in, Haddin plays it late, back to the bowler
Herath to Haddin, no run flighted outside off, Haddin doesn't play at it
Herath to Haddin, no run low-arm this time, it turns big too, but it is pitched well outside off, and he doesn't play at it
Herath to Haddin, no run flat, accurate, defended off the back foot

Randiv to Hussey, SIX runs another top shot from Hussey. Charges at Randiv, goes inside out over mid-off for the second six of the series. He was so close to the pitch of the ball the turn couldn't have bothered him
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run placed wide of mid-on for one

Randiv to Haddin, OUT Sharp offbreak, sharp catch! This is quick, turning in sharply, Haddin turns it around the corner... around the corner is Mathews at backward short leg who takes a smart low catch in front of him
Randiv to Johnson, no run this one doesn't turn in, pitches middle and leg, goes with the arm, beats him, hits him on the pad, but would have slid down the leg side
Randiv to Johnson, no run sharp turn and bounce outside off, Jayawardene is a jumping jack while collecting this
Randiv to Johnson, no run flighted outside off, Johnson gets forward and defends
Herath to Hussey, no run swept hard, into the shoulder of Paranavitana at forward short leg
Herath to Hussey, 1 run defended with an open face, gets a single to vacant point region
Herath to Johnson, no run floated outside off, left alone, not much turn
Herath to Johnson, no run nicely flighted, gets him driving away from the body, gets the inside edge, towards mid-on
Herath to Johnson, no run teasingly slow outside off, Johnson shoulders arms
Herath to Johnson, no run quicker, closer to off, defended
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run comes down the track and pushes this to long-off for one
Randiv to Johnson, no run beats him with an offbreak just outside off. Johnson's bat stays inside the line
Randiv to Johnson, no run sharp turn and bounce, beats the outside edge. Chest-high for PJ
Randiv to Johnson, no run this time left alone outside off
Randiv to Johnson, no run dip, turn and bounce. Pitches on a length, in front of off, turns away, and bounces over the stumps
Randiv to Johnson, no run this is a touch too straight, and Johnson defends off the front foot
Herath to Hussey, no run full and straight, pushed to mid-on
Herath to Hussey, 1 run sharp turn here, but this is short, and Hussey goes deep into the crease to help this around the corner
Herath to Johnson, no run more flight, drift and turn, Johnson goes to drive away from the body, against the turn, gets an inside edge because of the turn
Herath to Johnson, no run stays back this time, but it kicks off towards the rib region
Herath to Johnson, no run defended off the front foot, but not very convincingly, as this too kicks off from a length
Herath to Johnson, no run pushed away from the body, but off the middle of the bat, towards mid-off
Randiv to Hussey, no run Hussey pushes forward and defends this back to Randiv
Randiv to Hussey, no run flighted on middle and leg, Hussey defends this back to him
Randiv to Hussey, no run comes down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, drives it back to Randiv
Randiv to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off, spins away, Hussey plays with soft hands and an open face. Short third man is sharp, though
Randiv to Hussey, no run Edged and well short. Lovely bowling, pitches middle and off, turns away, Hussey's hands are soft, the edge is soft, and Mahela takes it on a half-volley at first slip
Randiv to Hussey, no run quicker, defended towards cover
Herath to Johnson, no run this is the carrom ball, pitches middle and leg, holds its line, hits Johnson in front of middle and leg. Kettleborough says no, and replays show a faint edge on the way
Herath to Johnson, 2 runs driven uppishly, not in control, but finds the gap in the covers
Herath to Johnson, 1 run flat, short, placed past point for one
Herath to Hussey, no run on the back foot to defend this one
Herath to Hussey, 1 run sweeps this along the ground for one
Herath to Johnson, no run flighted outside off, Johnson is well forward to defend
Randiv to Hussey, no run driven with the turn, can't beat extra cover
Randiv to Hussey, FOUR runs the calculating genius of Hussey, plays the rare aerial sweep shot, but in front of square, for four through midwicket
Randiv to Hussey, no run slower through the air, defends off the front foot
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run lovely running, just tips and runs to cover, and of all the places Sri Lanka is the toughest place to keep taking sharp singles all day long
Randiv to Johnson, no run slightly short of a length, defended with an open face
Randiv to Johnson, 2 runs Johnson's patience ends. He goes for the slog-sweep, gets a thick top edge over the slips
Herath to Hussey, no run quick, full, 93ks Hussey adjusts well, bringing the bat down in time
Herath to Hussey, 2 runs helped towards fine leg for a couple
Herath to Hussey, 1 run guides this past point for one
Herath to Johnson, 2 runs flighted outside off, driven against the turn, middle of the bat, along the ground, gets a couple
Herath to Johnson, 1 run drifting into the pads, helped away into the leg side
Herath to Hussey, no run floated across him, defended off the back foot
Randiv to Johnson, no run turn and bounce again, beats the outside edge as Johnson looks to defend

Randiv to Johnson, no run big appeal for a catch at the wicket. There is sharp turn and bounce, but there is also daylight between bat and pad. The shout more in hope than conviction. Can't fool Mr Dar
Randiv to Johnson, 2 runs too straight, worked into the leg side for two
Randiv to Johnson, 2 byes Where did this come from? Pitched on a length, just outside off, and explodes, chest high, and even PJ can't collect this
Randiv to Johnson, no run and he misses the edge again! This is flighted again, pitches on a length, in front of off, and with a puff of dust, kicks off. PJ does well this time to collect it
Randiv to Johnson, FOUR runs poor delivery to end the over, and Johnson is alert enough to crash this short delivery through the covers for four
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run starts with a full ball on the pads, and is picked away for a single
Lakmal to Johnson, no run angled across Johnson, left alone
Lakmal to Johnson, no run short of a length, pitched outside leg, hits Johnson's pads in front of middle. Rightly given not out

Lakmal to Johnson, OUT soft soft dismissal after many much more menacing deliveries! This is short and wide, going wider, but Johnson goes for the pull as opposed to the cut, and gets a faint bottom edge through to PJ. It was so innocuous the slips didn't even realise he had edged it!
Lakmal to Harris, no run shortish, widish, Harris leaves it be
Lakmal to Harris, no run good thinking, tries to slip in the yorker, off-stump line, Harris keeps it out, though
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run Hussey keeps nudging and deflecting. this time he stretches forward and drops this towards point for a single
Randiv to Harris, no run this one turns in sharply, Harris plays towards the short legs, but bisects them
Randiv to Harris, 1 run uppishly played, but between forward short leg and short midwicket
Randiv to Hussey, no run sharp turn and bounce, but this is pitched outside off, and he doesn't play at it
Randiv to Hussey, no run presses right forward to defend this to cover
Randiv to Hussey, no run slower offbreak, short to, Hussey covers the stumps, and shoulders arms

Lakmal to Harris, OUT Finally they get an lbw out of Kettleborough. This takes a long internal deliberation, though. This is short outside off, Harris doesn't offer a shot, the ball seams back in sharply, and hits him just under the knee roll, just outside off. Because he was not playing a shot, the point of impact was irrelevant. To me, it looked like it would have the the top of off. Kettleborough takes his time before
Lakmal to Copeland, FOUR runs gets a nice juicy full toss on the pads, and he glances it fine for an easy boundary. Sri Lanka is a very welcoming country, Trent
Lakmal to Copeland, no run back of a length, defended to leg
Lakmal to Copeland, no run length ball, pushed to cover
Lakmal to Copeland, no run full and wide, left alone harmlessly
Lakmal to Copeland, no run another harmless wide delivery, watches it through to PJ
Randiv to Hussey, no run pitched up outside off, left alone to turn away
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run slightly short, Hussey rocks back and cuts, doesn't farm the strike
Randiv to Copeland, no run sharp offbreak, padded away safely, the bounce means he couldn't have been lbw
Randiv to Copeland, no run more turn and bounce, and he lets this one hits his thigh pad
Randiv to Copeland, FOUR runs sweeps and sweeps effectively. Difficult shot for a tall man, but he sees this is close enough to him, and goes for it. Keeps it along the ground
Randiv to Copeland, no run overpitched around off, defended to cover
Lakmal to Hussey, no run Lakmal is short of a length, middle and leg, Hussey is solid as ever
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run fuller, but too straight, and he has worked it away into the leg side for one
Lakmal to Copeland, FOUR runs Copeland is hitting boundary after boundary! Short of a length, into the pads, nicely flicked away past square leg. Specialist batsmen would be proud of this
Lakmal to Copeland, no run short outside off, he lets PJ do the collecting
Lakmal to Copeland, no run full, outside off, driven handsomely, can't beat extra cover
Lakmal to Copeland, no run floated wide outside off, Copeland doesn't play at it
Randiv to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off, there is turn and bounce, but Hussey doesn't play at it
Randiv to Hussey, no run flatter, outside off, Hussey defends with an open face
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run short of a length, gets on his toes, and punches this for a single to sweeper-cover
Randiv to Copeland, no run drift, dip, turn, bounce, too good, because this turns back in through the bat-pad gap, misses the edge, and bounces over the stumps
Randiv to Copeland, no run overspinner, middle and off, doesn't turn, Copeland defends

Randiv to Copeland, OUT Sharp turn, simple bat-pad catch. This is flighted, draws Copeland forward, who looks to play this to leg, is not close to the pitch of the ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and an easy catch accrues for short leg
Lakmal to Hussey, no run low full toss, Hussey flicks this to mid-on
Lakmal to Hussey, no run Hussey charges at him and drives him straight down the ground... into the stumps at the non-striker's end
Lakmal to Hussey, no run low full toss again, driven back to Lakmal
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run length ball, on the pads, clipped away for one, happy to give the No. 11 two balls to survive
Lakmal to Lyon, no run nice yorker first up for the debutant. Swings in late, towards off, Lyon keeps this out
Lakmal to Lyon, no run Lyon is well for ward to push this length ball to point

Randiv to Hussey, SIX runs Has Welegedara pulled off a special catch? No he hasn't! This is a six! Hussey comes down the ground, chips this inside out towards long-off, Welegedara back-pedals and takes a good catch, only for his heel to step on the skirting. He claims the catch, though, but replays prove him wrong. Peter Siddle kept gesturing, asking them to stay and wait for the replays
Randiv to Hussey, no run flat delivery, Hussey deep in the crease to defend
Randiv to Hussey, no run another flat delivery, defended again
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run and he takes a single with two balls to go. Drops this into the vastly vacant cover region for one
Randiv to Lyon, no run flighted outside off, Lyon is well forward to defend
Randiv to Lyon, no run sharp offbreak again, but Lyon defends this towards short leg
Lakmal to Hussey, no run length ball on the pads, Hussey turns down the single
Lakmal to Hussey, no run driven to long-off, but refuses the single again
Lakmal to Hussey, no run driven to long-off, and he turns down another single
Lakmal to Hussey, 1 run and Hussey takes the single off the fourth ball again, worked away off the pads
Lakmal to Lyon, no run full toss, driven to long-off
Lakmal to Lyon, no run and he gets another yorker, which he ably keeps out
Randiv to Hussey, no run Short and wide, cut away, turns down the single
Randiv to Hussey, no run cut away again, keeps the strike again
Randiv to Hussey, no run jumps out of the crease, beaten in the flight, thrusts his pad forward

Randiv to Hussey, SIX runs Hussey's gem continues! Hits a six off the fourth ball of this over. Gives him the charge again, makes room, and lofts over long-on. Enters the 90s. Ponting applauds from the balcony
Randiv to Hussey, 1 run and Hussey reverse-paddles this to take the single. He is clearly out-thinking Sri Lanka here
Randiv to Lyon, no run tossed up outside off, left alone, turns back a long way, but not enough
Dilshan to Hussey, 2 leg byes sharp offbreak, pitches middle and off, beats the sweep, hits the pad, but would never had hit the stumps. Hussey takes two leg-byes
Dilshan to Hussey, FOUR runs and in the meantime, Hussey keeps going on. This is too straight and too full, Hussey sweeps this fine, beats long leg, is now one shot away from a hundred
Dilshan to Hussey, no run long hop, pulled away, turns down the single

Dilshan to Hussey, OUT Given leg-before! Again it's the straighter ball from an offspinner that has done the damage here. This pitched outside off, Hussey defended, playing for the spin, the ball went on with the arm, hit the pad, right in front of off. Kettleborough took his time, then raised the finger. Hussey reviewed it just in case. Replays say there is no just in case here

Nevertheless a superb innings from Hussey. The Sri Lankans congratulte him as he walks off. Michael Clarke applauds from the balcony. Despite Hussey's superb 95, though, Sri Lanka will be pleased to have restricted Australia to 273 after losing the toss. They will have one over to bat today. Generally, though, they wouldn't want to bat last on this wicket. Which means they will want a huge first-innings lead

The umpires think the light has gone bad enough to make the Sri Lanka batsmen head off without having to face what could have been a testing over. That will be it from us for today. This is Sidharth Monga signing off on behalf of Cricinfo. Join us tomorrow for the second day's action
Harris to Sangakkara, no run Harris bangs the ball in, couldn't me more different than Copeland who 'releases' it, left alone as it bounces outside off from back of a length
Harris to Sangakkara, no run another leave outside the off stump
Harris to Sangakkara, no run Ponting is lurking close by on the off side for that drive in the air, but Sanga keeps it along the ground as he pushes forward
Harris to Sangakkara, no run this one does not get up much at all outside off, Sanga watches it go past him, that will continue to be a worry for batsmen on this pitch, you cannot trust the bounce
Harris to Sangakkara, no run straightish one played out towards midwicket
Harris to Sangakkara, no run eep, now he goes flailing at a very full and widish one outside off, fortunately he does not get anything on it
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run Copeland on target again, close to off stump, hurls it in on a length, left alone
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run tighter line still, ending right on that off stump, pushed away on the off side
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run just outside the off stump now, talk about settling in on a line, Para gets to it and defends
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run now a leave to one not far from off stump
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run takes a step out and lets a length ball go across him outside off
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run now he finds some bounce as this one hangs in the air for a bit longer, lands on a length and kicks up outside off, fine leave in the end
Harris to Sangakkara, no run 136.5 kph from Harris, but he spotted the line early and allowed it go past him outside off
Harris to Sangakkara, no run makes him play with a much fuller length on the stumps, Sanga gets behind it and pushes down the track
Harris to Sangakkara, no run much fuller and going across, Sanga is a touch late on it in getting forward, but manages to push towards mid off
Harris to Sangakkara, no run touch wider outside off stump and he leaves it right away
Harris to Sangakkara, no run gets it to move away a shade from around middle and leg, but touch shortish and he is able to shuffle across, get in line and push it away

Harris to Sangakkara, no run fuller delivery produces the edge, not driving length, not short too, he is caught on the crease as it zips across from around leg, but the thick edge carries along the ground towards backward point

Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run Copeland goes full outside off stump, gets it to zip after pitching close to off, he gets forward with a bit of an open face to run it away, but it goes towards gully
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run left alone from a length outside off
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run 126 kph and too much outside off to interest him
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run smartly forward and smothers a length ball on the off side
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, 1 run full delivery driven past the man close in towards extra cover
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run slants it across the left-hander who takes a step out and watches it go, tight lines these, mighty tight
Harris to NT Paranavitana, no run 138.7 kph from Harris, hurries him in to a forward push towards covers
Harris to NT Paranavitana, no run well bowled, hurrying on from a length on off stump, he defends bat and pad close together
Harris to NT Paranavitana, no run the bouncer, surprises the batsman as it rears up at him, goes just over his head as he goes under
Harris to NT Paranavitana, 4 leg byes they havent given much till now, this one is a gift though, going down the pads and he gets enough on it to tickle it past Haddin
Harris to NT Paranavitana, no run superb leave from Para, close to the off stump on the angle, bouncing too, he shuffles across, and lets it go, couple of inches away from the body
Harris to NT Paranavitana, no run solid push off the front foot, straight to mid off
Copeland to Sangakkara, 1 run goes around middle and leg and Sanga picks him in front of square leg
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run gets forward to a full delivery outside off stump and allows it to past
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run Copeland looks like he could be bowling this line all day, around that off stump, Para leaves wisely
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, no run touch fuller, makes him go forward, head on top of ball, crouching low to defend
Copeland to NT Paranavitana, 1 run opens the face to a full one to run the drive past the man at very short cover

Copeland to Sangakkara, 1 run Ponting got one of these yesterday, it seemed to stop on him off a fullish length as he looked to push on the on side, just managed to clear midwicket, puff of dust as it pitched
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run fires it full and down the leg side first up
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run Johnson could be a handful on this track with the old ball I think, he sings it full now on middle, and has Sanga pushing it back down the track
Johnson to Sangakkara, 1 run a bit more on the angle from over the stumps, and Sanga pushes the fullish one between the bowler and mid on who does well to run across and cut it off
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run straightish one bouncing from a length, but a bit outside off, left alone
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run fuller on offnow, has him pushing down the track
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run 141 kph, in this heat, Johnson giving it a rip, getting it to hold its line outside off, he gets forward and runs it to gully
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run good leave from Sanga, he shuffled across, saw this one leaving him close to off and flagged it through

Copeland to Sangakkara, no run another good leave from Sanga, Copeland persevering outside off at 124.1 kph, won't bother many with that pace though, but it's that line, much like Praveen Kumar for India, who also gets a lot of swing
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run left alone as it bounces outside the off stump
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run slowish delivery, arrives on a length on off stump, he crouches low to block
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run right on the fourth stump, he pushes forward and defends on the off side
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run left alone this time, Haddin takes it snappily standing up
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run 141.9 kph from Mitch, but a touch far outside off to make him fiddle with it, remember, he is not Dilshan
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run good bouncer, Johnson bangs it in at 145.5 kph, he sways out of the line alright, but Haddin has to leap in the air to take it
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run yipe, Mitch goes off target on this one, lots of shoulder takes it way outside off from back of a length
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run that's the line, close to that off stump, from short of a length, has him pushing with an open face towards point
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run the full delivery now, not a bad one to bowl now and then, Para pushes it back to Mitch
Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run just a bit of away movement as he slings it widish outside off stump, left alone
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run 123.4 kph around that off stump, he allows it to go past

Copeland to Sangakkara, no run whoa, this one keeps a bit low, shouldn
Copeland to Sangakkara, no run pushed away on the off side from a length

Copeland to Sangakkara, 1 run they have made 14 in almost 12 overs and now they want a tight single, well well, it was tucked in front of square leg who raced in, dived forward but there was not much in the underarm lob to Haddin and Para had managed to sneak in by the time Haddin got the bails off
Johnson to Sangakkara, 1 run plonked in front of point and Sanga gets across for the single, they will need more of this

Johnson to NT Paranavitana, no run now he hurls it wide outside the off stump, giving Haddin a tough time at the moment, that's about it

Copeland to Sangakkara, FOUR runs that has been put away, Sanga gets width from Copeland, a rarity, and eagerly goes after it, getting the slash well over the slips

Lyon to Sangakkara, OUT he has struck first ball, would you believe it! he has got Kumar Sangakkara, of all men, what a first Test wicket to have, off your first ball, flight from round the wicket, grip, turn, bounce, Sanga hangs out the bat away from the body, with a bit of an open face, Clarke snaps it up low with a lunge to his left at slip, superb catch, aye, aye, this is an attack being led by the debutants at the m
Lyon to Mahela Jayawardene, no run turn and bounce from over the wicket, but going down leg as it kicks, Mahela withdraws the bat
Lyon to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs Mahela gets going with a lunge forward to a fuller one and a sweep that beats the man at deep square leg by a mile

Lyon to Mahela Jayawardene, no run tossed up too wide outside off, but it turns in hungrily, bounces a lot, but Mahela had it covered and shoulders arms

Lyon to NT Paranavitana, OUT Mahela is run out, what an absolute waste of a big wicket, shortish from round the stumps and slapped towards point off the back foot, they go for the single, but the fielder gets to the ball and lobs it off balance to Haddin who still manages to catch Mahela short of his ground, guess who it was, it was Copeland, and even if Mahela would have made it, Para could have been in trouble as he st

Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run oh boy, how has that missed off stump, but that aside, it is a brave leave from Para, it was angled in and tossed up full around off, straightened and headed for Para's bat but he got it out of the way in the end, Haddin could not believe that it missed off

Johnson to NT Paranavitana, (no ball) Mitch strikes first ball after lunch, or does he, umpire Kettleborough thinks for a moment and slowly raises the finger, Para shuffled well across the stumps looking to flick a length ball off middle and leg, was there some bat before he took it on the pad, Sri Lanka go for the review, but wait, Mitch seems to have overstepped, don't bother about inside edges and stuff, go back to

Johnson to Thilan Samaraweera, no run sharp bouncer from Mitch, he has been rather fired up after that reviewed no-ball, Thilan just about crouches under it

Lyon to Thilan Samaraweera, no run more blocking outside off from Thilan, perhaps they could do with a silly point
Lyon to Thilan Samaraweera, 3 runs invites the drive with a full delivery and finds Thilan eagerly accepting it with a stretch towards it and a caress past extra cover
Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, 2 runs angled in on the pads and he flicks uppishly through square leg
Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, no run Watson is getting some inward movement in the air straight away, Thilan gets a leading edge towards cover as he tries to work him on the leg side
Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, no run another one zips in a long way, Thilan is hurried in to a defensive jab outside off
Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, FOUR runs digs it in short, but with the angle on the pads, thilan shuffles to tickle it just past a diving Haddin

Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, no run Australia appeal for leg before but Thilan was struck well outside the line of off as he presses forward to one that came back in again, looked to be a bit of bat too
Watson to Thilan Samaraweera, no run he is wary of that inward movement and is playing off the back foot now, pushed back to the bowler
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, 1 run tossed up full but on leg and clipped in front of square
Lyon to Thilan Samaraweera, 1 run well played Thilan, down the track, takes it on the full and eases it to long on
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run tossed up from round the stumps, close to off, and he smothers it off the front foot as it turns away
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run angled in full from wide of the crease and pushed with the turn towards point
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run across and down the track outside off, but finds that he can only defend it away
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run floated up too full and too wide outside off, left alone
Watson to HAPW, no run shapes in predictably from Watson, but Prasanna is well forward in defence to keep it out on the off side
Watson to HAPW, no run nips in outside off stump, Pras pulls bat out of the line in the end
Watson to HAPW, no run that has come in a very long way, Pras chose to leave it as he saw it well outside off, but it tailed in and wasn't too far from off stump
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run goes for the full delivery, Angelo digs it out calmly
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, no run he plays a length ball off the back foot, it bounces and turns away but he is able to push it away
Lyon to NT Paranavitana, 1 run fired in fullish, he goes down and sweeps from around off to deep square leg
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run turns in sharply and bounces after drifting away, inside edge as he presses forward, towards short leg
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run defended down the track
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run tossed up ball, and he gets forward to push firmly to the bowler
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run blocked towards short leg
Watson to NT Paranavitana, no run slants it in full on the stumps, he works it towards short midwicket
Watson to NT Paranavitana, no run that almost sneaked through, at 137 kph too, darted in on a length with the angle, and Para keeps it out with an inside edge
Watson to NT Paranavitana, no run reaches away from the body and pushes a fuller one to cover

Watson to NT Paranavitana, OUT Watson continues to strike the pads, this time it is Para who has to depart, three wickets in three overs, end of Para's prolonged vigil, it kept low as it came in with the angle from round the stumps, he was caught in the crease and almost fell over as he missed the work on the leg side, that would have hit leg stump as Sri Lanka find on the review, two reviews against umpire Kettleborough
Watson to Randiv, 1 run goes for the stumps with a fuller incoming delivery, Randiv manages to work it behind square leg
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run short ball now from Watson, Angel gets head out of the way and allows it to go past
Lyon to Randiv, no run tries to push towards cover but it turns in sharply to go in the air towards Lyon who stops it with a dive
Lyon to Randiv, FOUR runs offspinner takes on offspinner, Randiv sees a tossed up ball and swings it over midwicket with the turn
Lyon to Randiv, no run goes for the slog sweep this time, from outside off, misses and is hit on the body
Lyon to Randiv, no run and then he plays a very careful forward defensive with soft hands that smothers the ball near the bat
Lyon to Randiv, no run pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
Lyon to Randiv, no run super fielding from Copeland at backward square leg, it was swept with the turn from middle and leg but he lunged to his left, stopped it and fired in the throw to Haddin
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run comes down the track to counter the incoming delivery, and tucks it towards midwicket
Watson to Angelo Mathews, 1 run clipped with the inward angle off the pads through square leg
Watson to Randiv, 1 run takes a step down the track and pushes solidly wide of extra cover for a single
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run low full toss around off stump, Angelo pushes it back down the track, Watto gets a hand to it and takes all the pace off it
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run gets front leg out of the way to work an incoming fullish one towards midwicket
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run hurries in from a length, he keeps it out with an angled bat
Lyon to Randiv, 1 run tossed up ball worked with the turn past midwicket
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, 2 runs deep midwicket saves the boundary with a tumbling stop to his right, it is Copeland again, Angelo had split the gap with a well-timed sweep
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run pushed on the off side
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, no run flighted very full, smothered down the track
Lyon to Angelo Mathews, 1 run short, flat and hurrying in, he goes back and slaps it towards cover
Lyon to Randiv, no run pushes away from the body, and the ball turns in and goes down the track off the inner part of the blade
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run hangs in the crease and guides with an open face to point
Watson to Angelo Mathews, no run jagging back in all the time from Watson, he uncertainly pushes it off an inside edge on the leg side
Watson to Angelo Mathews, 1 run dug in shortish, he gets on top to punch wide of extra cover to bring up the 100
Watson to Randiv, no run gets outside the crease and works towards midwicket
Watson to Randiv, no run width outside off, but the movement means Randiv mistimes the push to mid off
Watson to Randiv, no run guided to point from the crease, a touch short from Watto
Lyon to Herath, no run takes off and through Haddin's gloves outside off as Lyon finds bounce from a length, Herath leaves
Lyon to Lakmal, 1 run worked in the air just past short leg for a single
Lyon to Randiv, no run pushed off the front foot on the off side
Lyon to Randiv, 1 run down the track and eases with the turn to long on, keeps strike
Watson to Randiv, no run quietly defends one coming in off the front foot
Watson to Randiv, no run fuller and coming in as usual, he keeps it out with a forward defensive
Watson to Randiv, 1 run just a bit of width outside off and he squeezes it behind point
Watson to Lakmal, no run still fuller, he as late in getting forward but eventually got the front foot out a shade and managed to push it away as it tailed in
Watson to Lakmal, no run goes after a pitched up delivery that moves in a long way, inside edge that Haddin cannot stop cleanly
Watson to Lakmal, no run survives, keeps out a length ball with a straight bat
Lyon to Welegedara, no run gets forward and keeps out a turning length ball
Lyon to Welegedara, 1 run nudged with the turn past forward short leg
Lyon to Lakmal, 1 run charges down the track and heaves down to long on
Lyon to Welegedara, no run turn and bounce, was there a bit of glove on that, far away from short leg though

On Test debut, a proud Nathan Lyon leads Australia off the field with the ball in his hands. No fight at all from Sri Lanka, they were always under pressure after Dilshan's needless bravado early on. Australia doing everything right, seamers not giving anything away in terms of width or driving length, spinner coming in superbly on a helpful pitch, and allrounder proving his value with deadly reverse swing. Fielding backing up
Innings Start
Cricnazi: "wonder how many the two teams would've managed had warne and muralidharan bowled on this track!!"
